intro: Myosotis dissitiflora, commonly known as the scattered-flowered forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers on slender stalks. Myosotis dissitiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also an important species in ecological studies due to its specific habitat requirements.
